com.whirvis.jraknet.discovery

Class Discovery

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.discovery.Discovery

  • public final class Discovery
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to discover servers on the local network and on external networks.
    Since:
    JRakNet v2.11.0
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin
    See Also:
    DiscoveryMode, DiscoveredServer, DiscoveryListener, setDiscoveryMode(DiscoveryMode), addListener(DiscoveryListener)

    • Method Detail

      • getTimestamp

        protected static long getTimestamp()
        Returns the timestamp of the discovery system.

        The timestamp of the discovery system is how long in milliseconds has passed since it has been created.

        Returns:
        the timestamp of the discovery system.

      • getPingId

        protected static long getPingId()
        Returns the ping ID of the discovery system.
        Returns:
        the ping ID of the discovery system.

      • getDiscoveryMode

        public static DiscoveryMode getDiscoveryMode()
        Returns the discovery mode.

        The discovery mode determines how server server discovery is handled.

        Returns:
        the discovery mode.

      • setDiscoveryMode

        public static void setDiscoveryMode(DiscoveryMode mode)
        Sets the discovery mode.

        If disabling the discovery system, all of the currently discovered servers will be treated as if they had been forgotten. If discovery is enabled once again later on, all servers listed for discovery via addPort(int) and addServer(InetSocketAddress) will be rediscovered. To stop this from occurring, they can be removed via removePort(int) and removeServer(DiscoveredServer)

        Parameters:
        mode - the new discovery mode. A null value will have the discovery mode be set to DiscoveryMode.DISABLED.

      • addListener

        public static void addListener(DiscoveryListener listener)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds a DiscoveryListener to the discovery system.

        Listeners are used to listen for events that occur relating to the discovery system such as discovering servers, forgetting servers, etc.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the listener is null.

      • removeListener

        public static void removeListener(DiscoveryListener listener)
        Removes a DiscoveryListener from the discovery system.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove.

        Parameters:

                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        Parameters:
        ports - the ports.
        Returns:
        true if all of the ports are being broadcasted to, false otherwise.

      • getPorts

        public static int[] getPorts()
        Returns the ports that are being broadcasted to on the local network.
        Returns:
        the ports that are being broadcasted to on the local network.

      • addPorts

        public static void addPorts(int... ports)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Starts broadcasting to the specified ports on the local network for server discovery.

        It is also possible to discovery only certain servers on the local network via addServer(InetSocketAddress) if desired.

        Parameters:
        ports - the ports to start broadcasting to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the ports is not in between 0-65535.

      • addPort

        public static void addPort(int port)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Starts broadcasting to the specified port on the local network for server discovery.

        It is also possible to discovery only certain servers on the local network via addServer(InetSocketAddress) if desired.

        Parameters:
        port - the port to start broadcasting to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not within the range of 0-65535.

      • removePorts

        public static void removePorts(int... ports)
        Stops broadcasting to the specified ports on the local network.
        Parameters:
        ports - the ports to stop broadcasting to.

      • removePort

        public static void removePort(int port)
        Stops broadcasting to the specified port on the local network.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to stop broadcasting to.

      • clearPorts

        public static void clearPorts()
        Stops broadcasting to all ports.

        To stop broadcasting to a specific port, use the removePort(int) method.

      • setPorts

        public static void setPorts(int... ports)
                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sets the ports that will be broadcasted to on the local network.

        This method is simply a shorthand for addPort(int) and removePort(int). The way this method works is by adding all ports in the ports parameter that are not already up for discovery, and removing all ports that are up for discovery but not found in the ports parameter. If the ports parameter is empty, the clearPorts() method will be called instead.

        Parameters:
        ports - the ports to broadcast to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ports are null.

      • hasServers

        public static boolean hasServers(java.net.InetSocketAddress... servers)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns whether or not the specified servers are being broadcasted to.
        Parameters:
        servers - the servers
        Returns:
        true if all of the servers are being broadcasted to, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the servers are null.

      • hasServer

        public static boolean hasServer(java.net.InetSocketAddress server)
        Returns whether or not the specified server is being broadcasted to.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        Returns:
        true if the server is being broadcasted to, false otherwise.

      • getServers

        public static java.net.InetSocketAddress[] getServers()
        Returns the external servers that are being broadcasted to.
        Returns:
        the external servers that are being broadcasted to.

      • addServer

        public static void addServer(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Starts broadcasting to the specified server address for server discovery.

        This allows for the discovery of servers on external networks. If discovering servers on the local network, it is possible to discover all servers running on a specified port via the addPort(int) method.

        Parameters:
        address - the server address.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address or the IP address of the address are null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the IP address of address is the broadcast address of "255.255.255.255".

      • addServer

        public static void addServer(java.net.InetAddress address,
                             int port)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Starts broadcasting to the specified server address for server discovery.

        This allows for the discovery of servers on external networks. If discovering on the local network, it is possible to discover all servers running on a specified port via the addPort(int) method.

        Parameters:
        address - the server IP address.
        port - the server port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not in between 0-65535 or the address is the broadcast address of "255.255.255.255".

      • addServer

        public static void addServer(java.lang.String host,
                             int port)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.net.UnknownHostException
        Starts broadcasting to the specified server address for server discovery.

        This allows for the discovery of servers on external networks. If discovering on the local network, it is possible to discover all servers running on a specified port via the addPort(int) method.

        Parameters:
        host - the server IP address.
        port - the server port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the host is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not in between 0-65535 or the host is the broadcast address of "255.255.255.255".
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.

      • removeServer

        public static void removeServer(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Stops broadcasting to the specified server address.
        Parameters:
        address - the server address.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the address is not that of an external server.

      • removeServer

        public static void removeServer(java.net.InetAddress address,
                                int port)
        Stops broadcasting to the specified server address.
        Parameters:
        address - the server IP address.
        port - the server port.

      • removeServer

        public static void removeServer(java.lang.String host,
                                int port)
                         throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Stops broadcasting to the specified server address.
        Parameters:
        host - the server IP address.
        port - the server port.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.

      • removeServer

        public static void removeServer(DiscoveredServer server)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Stops broadcasting to the specified discovered server.
        Parameters:
        server - the discovered server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the server is not an external server.

      • setServers

        public static void setServers(java.net.InetSocketAddress... servers)
                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sets the servers that will be broadcasted to.

        This method is simply a shorthand for addServer(InetSocketAddress) and removeServer(InetSocketAddress). The way this method works is by adding all ports in the servers parameter that are not already up for discovery, and removing all ports that are up for discovery but not found in the servers parameter. If the ports parameter is empty, the clearServers() method will be called instead.

        Parameters:
        servers - the servers to broadcast to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if servers are null.

      • clearServers

        public static void clearServers()
        Stops broadcasting to all server addresses. To stop broadcasting to a specific server address, use the removeServer(InetSocketAddress) method.

      • getDiscovered

        public static DiscoveredServer[] getDiscovered()
        Returns the discovered servers, both local and external.
        Returns:
        the discovered servers, both local and external.
        See Also:
        getLocal(), getExternal()

      • getLocal

        public static DiscoveredServer[] getLocal()
        Returns the locally discovered servers.
        Returns:
        the locally discovered servers.

      • getExternal

        public static DiscoveredServer[] getExternal()
        Returns the externally discovered servers.
        Returns:
        the externally discovered servers.

      • updateDiscoveryData

        protected static void updateDiscoveryData(java.net.InetSocketAddress sender,
                                          UnconnectedPong pong)
                                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates discovery information for the server with the specified address.
        Parameters:
        sender - the server address.
        pong - the decoded unconnected pong packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the sender is null or the IP address of the sender is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pong packet failed to decode.
